summary: A collection of magic enhancements that you can pick and choose from.
descriptionHtml:

[/i][/b][/size][b][i]First and foremost, what I mean by "touch" is simply the act of what looks like touching your target

when you cast a spell and no projectile is fired. It could be from any distance, long or short.


Â Second, no I did not alter perks.
[/i][/b]

[youtube]aayU9oxUVD0[/youtube]

______________________________________

[size=6][b]Details[/b][/size]

[b]SPELLS[/b]

This mod adjusts certain spells to make it easier to hit your target with.

E.g. Illusion spells, Reanimation spells, and Turn Undead spells.


Now, these spells work as long/short distant touch spells. They keep their vanilla range.

It sounds minimal, but trust me; these changes make a huge difference.

Specially, when attempting to reanimate a corpse mid combat.



[b]STAVES[/b]

On top of adjusting their delivery method, staves were also assimilated.

To enhance the staves, their level cap has been removed so that they are on par with the spells.

Also, they benefit from perks, which is a huge change that makes a difference.

E.g. Intense Flames perk will work on fire staves,

Dark Souls perk will work on reanimation staves.



[b]SCROLLS (Add-on)[/b]

Scrolls were sadly under-powered compared to spells and staves.

Now, their level caps and magnitudes are the same as their spell counterparts.

The downside is they don't benefit from perk trees.



[b]VISUALS AND SOUNDS (Add-on)

[/b]Some spells looked and sounded ugly, let's be honest.

Fire spells have new hand effect visuals that look much better.

Poison Rune has new hand effect visuals that look more appropriate.

Reanimation spells have new sound effects that simply sounds more immersive.

Illusion spells now look different from one another.

E.g. Fury and Courage have distinct hand effect visuals from Fear and Calm.

Vampiric Drain has new hand effect visuals that look more like " blood magic".

It also has new sounds that fit the "drain blood" idea. The new sound is a heart beating and absorbing noise.

CHECK SCREENSHOTS FOR VISUAL REFERENCE
